text.div:
BC ExtraCapsularExtensionOfNodalTumorStatus Logical Model

Status for presence of extranodal extension of carcinoma where extranodal extension is the perforation of a cancer through the capsule of a lymph node into the tissue surrounding the node.

name: ExtraCapsularExtensionOfNodalTumorStatusModel
title: BC ExtraCapsularExtensionOfNodalTumorStatus Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description: Status for presence of extranodal extension of carcinoma where extranodal extension is the perforation of a cancer through the capsule of a lymph node into the tissue surrounding the node.

keyword.display: Extranodal extension of carcinoma [Presence] in Cancer specimen by Light microscopy

element.definition: Status for presence of extranodal extension of carcinoma where extranodal extension is the perforation of a cancer through the capsule of a lymph node into the tissue surrounding the node.

element.definition: Code representing status for presence of extranodal extension of carcinoma where extranodal extension is the perforation of a cancer through the capsule of a lymph node into the tissue surrounding the node.

element.short: The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement.
element.definition:
The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement.

For action topics, the TopicCode represents the action being described. For findings, the TopicCode represents the 'question' or property being investigated. For evaluation result findings, the TopicCode contains a concept for an observable entity, such as systolic blood pressure. For assertion findings, the TopicCode contains a code representing the condition, allergy, or other item being asserted. In all cases, the TopicCode describes the topic independent of the context of the action or the finding.

element.definition: The usual or acceptable range for a test result.
